availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Levin Cooper (Hancock County, KY, merchant & postmaster)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Davison Cooper. Father of Sallie Cooper and Josephine Cooper. Merchant in Hancock County in 1850. Postmaster of Hawesville, Kentucky, from November 1851 to August 1855, June 1861 to July 1862, and December 1862 to July 1870.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 271A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 1027.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Hancock County, Kentucky, vol. 28.
